result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mohamad Eusoff-Bin Mohamad-Akbar

records.addlTxt:
No Justice Point monitoring. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Defendant is to make all court appearances.

Case is adjourned to 11-10-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Mohamad Eusoff Bin Mohamad-Akbar in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Mohamad Eusoff Bin Mohamad-Akbar.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn Royhinga Interpreter: Shaukhat Ali:
Case in court for return on doctor's report.  State and defense have received and reviewed the report.  No challenges to the report. Court adopts the findings of the report and finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates proceedings. Case is adjourned to 11-10-22 at 8:30 am for a status conference.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed.

Defendant Mohamad Eusoff Bin Mohamad-Akbar in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Mohamad Eusoff Bin Mohamad-Akbar.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn Royhinga Interpreter: Shaukhat Ali.
Case in court to set up a competency hearing with the interpreter.  The clerk contacted the Forensic Unit.  The defendant and the interpreter will appear at the forensic unit to meet with doctor on the date as stted on the record.  Case is adjourned to 10-5-22 at 8:30 am for return on doctor's report.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from Dr. Seipel to the Court, filed.

Defendant Mohamad Eusoff-Bin Mohamad-Akbar in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video conference.
Royhinga interpreter not available.  Case in court for return on doctor's report.  Defendant has gone to Forensic Unit to be interviewed but the Royhinga Interpreter failed to appear at all four appointments.  Court ordered case adjourned for a status conference on 9-14-22 at 8:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM036902  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFF
07/29/2022
per the bail schedule. Because no initial appearance has been held due to competency being raised, bail is set pursuant to bail schedule for original referred in charges.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Mohamad Eusoff Bin Mohamad-Akbar not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Doctor's Report Return. Defendant not produced. Doctor unable to interview defendant because no Royhinga interpreter has been available. Defense counsel requests bail be set, due to reasons put forth on the record. Arguments heard. Court will allow defendant to post bail as previously set on ADR. Court further orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect. Case adjourned to br 10.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from the forensic unit, filed.
from defendant, filed.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Mohamad Eusoff-Bin Mohamad-Akbar not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a return on doctor's report. No Royhinga interpreter is available.  Doctor is requesting more time to complete the report.  Defense is objecting and requesting the Court set bail. Court denied defense request to set bail. Defendant remains remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case is adjourned to 7-29-22 at 9:00 am for return on doctor's report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter to the Court from Wisconsin Forensic Unit.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Mohamad Eusoff-Bin Mohamad-Akbar not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a return on doctors report.  The doctor is requesting more time to complete the report.  Case is adjourned to 7-14-22 at 8:30 am for return on doctor's report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from  Dr. Seipel requesting and extension, filed
Sworn as Rohingya interpreter: Uddin, Khinma
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Mohamad Eusoff-Bin Mohamad-Akbar in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Mohamad Eusoff-Bin Mohamad-Akbar in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mohamad Eusoff-Bin Mohamad-Akbar appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
